text: St Volodymyr Chapel (properly Grand Prince St. Vladimir, Equal-to-the- Apostles) is a small Eastern Orthodox Chapel which serves the Vernadsky Research Base on Galindez Island, Antarctica. It is one of eight churches in Antarctica. The chapel, a simple wooden construction, was built on the island in 2011. Its creation was funded by philanthropists. It was consecrated by the Archbishop of Lviv and Galicia. Despite its small size, the chapel is richly decorated. Its contents include an icon of St Nicholas. ==References== Category:Churches completed in 2011 Category:2011 establishments in Antarctica Category:Churches in Antarctica Category:21st-century Eastern Orthodox church buildings
title: St. Volodymyr Chapel
